sentences: Ta oli paljude sõprade seas populaarne.
Paljude aastate pärast naasis ta kodulinna.
context: The word 'paljude' is the partitive plural form of the Estonian word 'palju', which means 'many' or 'much'. In this case, it's used to indicate that something belongs to or concerns many people/things. The '-de' ending indicates the plural partitive case, commonly used in Estonian to express possession, association, or quantity when referring to multiple items.
